thanks-thank:
{{Doc-actionlink}}
A link to thank another user. This appears next to messages such as {{msg-mw|editundo}} and {{msg-mw|rollbacklink}} and should be translated in a similar fashion.

For languages that need it, the gender of each of the thanked and thanking users is available.

Parameters:
* $1 - The user that is thanking
* $2 - The user that is being thanked

{{Identical|Thank}}
thanks-thanked:
This message immediately replaces the message {{msg-mw|Thanks-thank}} after it's pressed. It means that the thanking operation has been completed. It can be translated as "''thanked''" in "You ''thanked'' the user" or "The user has just been ''thanked''" - whatever is appropriate to your language.

For languages that need it, the gender of each of the thanked and thanking users is available.

Parameters:
* $1 - The user that is thanking
* $2 - The user that has been thanked

{{Identical|Thanked}}
thanks-button-thank:
Text of a button to thank another user. Same as {{msg-mw|Thanks-thank}}, but the context is in a button.

For languages that need it, the gender of each of the thanked and thanking users is available.

Parameters:
* $1 - The user that is thanking
* $2 - The user that is being thanked

{{Identical|Thank}}
thanks-button-thanked:
This message immediately replaces the message {{msg-mw|Thanks-button-thank}} after it's pressed. It means that the thanking operation has been completed. Same as {{msg-mw|Thanks-thanked}}, but the context is in a button.

For languages that need it, the gender of each of the thanked and thanking users is available.

Parameters:
* $1 - The user that is thanking
* $2 - The user that has been thanked

{{Identical|Thanked}}
thanks-button-action-queued:
Informs the user the thanks will happen ($1)
Parameters:
$1 - username 
$2 - gender
thanks-button-action-cancel:
Follows {{msg-mw|thanks-button-action-queued}} and is clickable to cancel the action.
{{Identical|Cancel}}
thanks-error-undefined: Error message that is displayed when the thank action fails. $1 is the error code returned by the API (an English string).
thanks-error-invalid-log-id: Error message that is displayed when the thank action can't find the log entry it's supposed to thank for.
thanks-error-invalid-log-type: Error message that is displayed when thanks is attempted for a log entry of a non-whitelisted type. $1 is the offending log type.
thanks-error-log-deleted: Error message that is displayed when thanks is attempted for a deleted log entry.
thanks-error-invalidrevision: Error message that is displayed when the revision ID is not valid
thanks-error-revdeleted: Error message that is displayed when the revision has been deleted (RevDel)
thanks-error-notitle: Error message that is displayed when the title of the page cannot be determined
thanks-error-invalidrecipient: Error message that is displayed when no recipient is found
thanks-error-invalidrecipient-bot: Error message that is displayed when the recipient is a bot
thanks-error-invalidrecipient-self: Error message that is displayed when the recipient is the user doing the thanking
thanks-error-notloggedin: Error message that is displayed when the user is not logged in
thanks-error-ratelimited:
Error message that is displayed when user exceeds rate limit.

Parameters:
* $1 - The user sending the thanks. Can be used for GENDER support.
thanks-error-api-params: Error message shown when both the 'rev' and 'log' API parameters are absent
thanks-thank-tooltip:
Tooltip that appears when a user hovers over the "thank" link.

Parameters:
* $1 - The user sending the thanks. Can be used for GENDER support.
* $2 - The user receiving the thanks. Can be used for GENDER support.
thanks-thank-tooltip-no:
Tooltip that appears when a user hovers over the {{msg-mw|confirmable-no}} link, which cancels the thank action.

Parameters:
* $1 - The user sending the thanks. Can be used for GENDER support.
thanks-thank-tooltip-yes:
Tooltip that appears when a user hovers over the {{msg-mw|confirmable-yes}} link, which confirms the thank action.

Parameters:
* $1 - The user sending the thanks. Can be used for GENDER support.
thanks-thanked-notice:
Pop-up message that is displayed after a user has thanked another user for their edit.

Parameters:
* $1 - The linked username of the user that was thanked.
* $2 - The username of the user that was thanked. Can be used for GENDER support.
* $3 - The username of the user sending the thanks. Can be used for GENDER support.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|Flow-thanks-thanked-notice}}
thanks-submit:
The text of the submit button on the Special:Thanks page.

{{Identical|Send thanks}}
echo-pref-subscription-edit-thank:
Option for getting notifications when someone thanks the user for their edit.

This is the conclusion of the sentence begun by the header: {{msg-mw|Prefs-echosubscriptions}}.
notification-thanks-diff-link: The text of a link to the user's edit. Used for $2 in {{msg-mw|Notification-thanks}}. Should have capitalization appropriate for the middle of a sentence. This is an object in a sentence so it should be in object case in languages where there is a special object form for words.
notification-header-rev-thank:
Header text for a notification when a user is thanked for their edit. Parameters:
* $1 is the username of the user sending the thanks (not suitable for GENDER).
* $2 is the thanking user's name for use in GENDER.
* $3 is the title of the page the thanked user edited.
* $4 is the username of the user being thanked, for use in GENDER.
notification-header-creation-thank:
Header text for a notification when a user is thanked for their creation of a page. Parameters:
* $1 is the username of the user sending the thanks (not suitable for GENDER).
* $2 is the thanking user's name for use in GENDER.
* $3 is the title of the page the thanked user created.
* $4 is the username of the user being thanked, for use in GENDER.
notification-header-log-thank:
Header text for a notification when a user is thanked for a log entry. Parameters:
* $1 is the username of the user sending the thanks (not suitable for GENDER).
* $2 is the thanking user's name for use in GENDER.
* $3 is the title of the page that is the target of the log entry.
* $4 is the username of the user being thanked, for use in GENDER.
notification-compact-header-edit-thank:
Compact header text for a notification when a user is thanked for their edit. Parameters:
* $1 is the username of the user sending the thanks (not suitable for GENDER).
* $2 is the thanking user's name for use in GENDER.
* $3 is the username of the user being thanked, for use in GENDER.
notification-bundle-header-rev-thank:
Bundle header text for a notification when a user is thanked for their edit. Parameters:
* $1 is the number of users who sent thanks for the same edit. When used with PLURAL, the value 100 represents more than 99.
* $2 is the title of the page the thanked user edited.
* $3 is the username of the user being thanked, for use in GENDER.
{{Related|Notification-bundle}}
notification-bundle-header-log-thank:
Bundle header text for a notification when a user is thanked for a log entry. Parameters:
* $1 is the number of users who sent thanks for the same edit. When used with PLURAL, the value 100 represents more than 99.
* $2 is the title of the page that is the target of the log entry.
* $3 is the username of the user being thanked, for use in GENDER.
{{Related|Notification-bundle}}
log-name-thanks: Name of log that appears on [[Special:Log]].
logentry-thanks-thank:
Log entry that is created when a user thanks another user for an edit. Parameters:
* $1 is a user link, for example "Jane Doe (Talk | contribs)"
* $2 is a username. Can be used for GENDER.
* $3 is a user link, for example "John Doe (Talk | contribs)
* $4 is the username of the recipient. Can be used for GENDER.
{{Identical|Thanked}}
thanks-error-no-id-specified: Error message shown to the user when they visit Special:Thanks without specifying a revision ID
notification-link-text-view-post: Label for button that links to a comment on a Flow board
notification-link-text-view-logentry: Label for button that links to a log entry
thanks-error-invalidpostid: Error message that is displayed when the Flow post UUID is not valid
flow-thanks-thanked-notice:
{{doc-singularthey}}
Message displayed after a user has thanked another user for their comment.

Parameters:
* $1 - The linked username of the user that was thanked.
* $2 - The username of the user that was thanked. Can be used for GENDER support.
* $3 - The user sending the thanks. Can be used for GENDER support.

See also:
* {{msg-mw|thanks-thanked-notice}}
notification-flow-thanks-post-link: The text of a link to the comment made by the user. Used for $2 in {{msg-mw|notification-flow-thanks}}. Should have capitalization appropriate for the middle of a sentence. This is an object in a sentence so it should be in object case in languages where there is a special object form for words.
notification-header-flow-thank:
Header text for a notification when a user is thanked for their comment on a Flow board.

Parameters:
* $1 – The username of the user sending the thanks (not suitable for GENDER).
* $2 – Either unused by the translation, or the thanking user's name for use in GENDER.
* $3 – The title of the topic the comment belongs to.
* $4 – The title of the page where the comment is located.
* $5 – Either unused by the translation, or the username of the user being thanked, for use in GENDER.

{{related|Notification-header-flow}}
notification-compact-header-flow-thank:
Compact header text for a notification when a user is thanked for their comment on a Flow board.

Parameters:
* $1 – The username of the user sending the thanks (not suitable for GENDER).
* $2 – Either unused by the translation, or the thanking user's name for use in GENDER.
* $3 – Either unused by the translation, or the username of the user being thanked, for use in GENDER.

{{related|Notification-header-flow}}
notification-bundle-header-flow-thank:
Bundle header text for a notification when a user is thanked for their comment on a Flow board.

Parameters:
* $1 – The number of users who sent thanks for the same post. When used with PLURAL, the value 100 represents more than 99.
* $2 – The title of the topic the comment belongs to.
* $3 – Either unused by the translation, or the username of the user being thanked, for use in GENDER.

{{related|Notification-header-flow}}
